intro: Panargyrus oligocephalus, commonly known as the narrow-headed snail, is a species of air-breathing land snail. It belongs to the family Cyclophoridae and is native to the island of Socotra in the Arabian Sea. The snail is characterized by its elongated, narrow shell that is typically pale in color with a smooth surface. It thrives in humid, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
